articles.author: Matthew Elder
articles.description: Marco Tilio revealed that his move to Celtic has been years in the making as he faced reporters for the first time since completing his switch from Melbourne City.
articles.title: Celtic have been tracking me for years - I spoke to one Aussie about move but not Ange Postecoglou

articles.author: Joel Sked
articles.description: Former Celtic captain Scott Brown has extended his stay with English League One side Fleetwood Town.
articles.title: Ex-Celtic captain Scott Brown signs new Fleetwood Town deal, contract length, what he said

articles.author: Matthew Elder
articles.description: Celtic goalkeeper Joe Hart has hailed Jack Butland's transfer to Rangers as a "good move" but stopped short of wishing his friend well out of “respect” for the Old Firm rivalry.
articles.title: 'We go way back' - Celtic's Joe Hart on his link to new Rangers arrival but why 'respect' comes first

articles.author: Joel Sked
articles.description: Scottish Premiership clubs are continuing to work towards the new league season with on-field and off-field preparation. Some sides have travelled abroad for a warm-weather training camp, while others have already played a number of friendlies with competitive games beginning on a week on Saturday with the Viaplay Cup group stages. Away from the pitch managers and sporting directors are making tweaks to the squad with a couple of clubs yet to sign anyone. As for individuals from last season, there are a number of players who are still without a club...
articles.title: 9 most interesting out of contact Premiership stars - ex-Celtic star, Rangers fan favourite, Hearts & Aberdeen winger

articles.author: Joel Sked
articles.description: It is just over a week until the start of the competitive season in Scotland with the start of the Viaplay Cup group stages.It will also be an important time for clubs to work further on their squad building ahead of the new league campaign.
articles.title: Scottish transfers: Celtic battle EPL side for striker, Rangers-linked star and £8m-rated ex-Hearts ace wanted

articles.description: Daizen Maeda has handed Celtic another attacking boost by signing a new deal until June 2027.
articles.title: Daizen Maeda signs new Celtic contract - deal length, what the player said, Brendan Rodgers delight

articles.title: Aberdeen sign former Celtic player as Dons confirm sixth summer recruit

articles.description: Celtic are ramping up their transfer business ahead of Brendan Rodgers’ first season back at the helm ...

articles.author: Joel Sked
articles.description: The Scottish Premiership season will get under way in just a month’s time. Plenty is expected to happen between now and then with clubs ramping up their on-field preparation and still looking to get key deals done in the transfer market.
articles.title: Scottish transfers: Bid for Rangers star, Celtic in signing boost, Hibs to land Hearts-linked midfielder

articles.author: Joel Sked
articles.description: So far, more than 40 transfer deals have been completed by Scottish Premiership clubs as they prepare for the start of the new campaign, whether it be the Viaplay Cup group stages, the league season and Europe. Yet, what is perhaps more intriguing, are the stars who have been linked with a move away or face an uncertain future at their clubs. The Scotsman takes a look at six such individuals ...
articles.title: 6 Premiership stars to watch in the transfer window - Celtic, Hearts and Rangers trio attracting interest

articles.author: Joel Sked
articles.description: There is just over a month until the start of the new Scottish Premiership and less than two weeks until the Viaplay Cup group stages get under way. Clubs have been working on the field and also building a squad for the upcoming campaign. Both continue apace...
articles.title: Scottish transfers: Rangers near €5m target, second could follow, Celtic to lose star man, Hearts winger blow

articles.description: REMEMBER when Chris Sutton was barred from performing his BT Sport duties at Ibrox because the club “could not guarantee his safety”? That was one, high-profile figure. A man who would have been surrounded by colleagues, in an enclosed part of the stadium, and whose profile means that any jeopardising of his safety would be glaringly obvious to any of the police and security personnel on duty. It would take a special kind of person to decide to jeopardise his safety.
